intro: Strobilanthes oligocephala, commonly known as the "Ceylon flame-of-the-forest," is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in dense, showy spikes and bloom during the rainy season. Strobilanthes oligocephala is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral displays.
